_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Four reasons to relish schism in the Saṅ: A bad monk is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.
A bad monk has wrong view and is attached to an extremist view.
A bad monk has wrong livelihood and earns a living by wrong livelihood.
A bad monk desires material possessions, honor, and admiration.
